metadata.title: The Peer Name Resolution Protocol must not be installed.

metadata.title: Permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
metadata.description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

criterion.comment: The System event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
The System event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.

metadata.title: Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Member and Standalone Servers
metadata.description: The Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services user right on member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local administrator accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

criteria.comment: Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Non-Domain Joined Servers

criterion.comment: The system is not a member of a domain
Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Guests

criteria.comment: Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Domain Joined Member Servers

extend_definition.comment: If the system is a domain joined member server

criterion.comment: Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Guests
Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Domain Admins
Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Enterprise Admins
Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Local account

metadata.title: Permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
metadata.description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

criterion.comment: The Security event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
The Security event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
The Security event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
The Security event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'

metadata.title: Kerberos Encryption Types
metadata.description: Kerberos encryption types must be configured to prevent the use of DES and RC4 encryption suites.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos' is set to 'Enabled' with 'AES128_HMAC_SHA1', 'AES256_HMAC_SHA1', 'Future encryption types'

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000420
metadata.description: Attachments must be prevented from being downloaded from RSS feeds.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Prevent downloading of enclosures' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Named Pipes and Shares
metadata.description: Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: User Account Control must automatically deny standard user requests for elevation.
metadata.description: User Account Control must automatically deny standard user requests for elevation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users' is set to 'Automatically deny elevation requests'

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP Based Clients
metadata.description: The system must be configured to meet the minimum session security requirement for NTLM SSP based clients.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients' is set to 'Require NTLMv2 session security'
Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients' is set to 'Require 128-bit encryption'

metadata.title: WN16-MS-000030
metadata.description: Local users on domain-joined computers must not be enumerated.

extend_definition.comment: If the system is a domain joined member server

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Enumerate local users on domain-joined computers' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Security Account Manager (SAM) RPC
metadata.description: Remote calls to the Security Account Manager (SAM) must be restricted to Administrators.

criteria.comment: IF system is a Member Server, THEN check the SAM settings are configured to only allow remote calls from Administrators.

criterion.comment: Allow Administrators group to make remote calls to SAM

metadata.title: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server
metadata.description: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Bad Logon Counter Reset
metadata.description: The time before the bad-logon counter is reset must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Reset account lockout counter after' is set to at least '15' minutes
Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: The 'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature must not be installed
metadata.description: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be uninstalled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000350
metadata.description: Turning off File Explorer heap termination on corruption must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off heap termination on corruption' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Limit Blank Passwords
metadata.description: Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UR: Add workstations to domain
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Add workstations to domain user right.

criteria.comment: IF system is a DC, THEN check Add workstations to domain

criterion.comment: Add workstations to domain - Administrators

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000520
metadata.description: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Digest authentication.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Disallow Digest authentication' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000380
metadata.description: Local drives must be prevented from sharing with Remote Desktop Session Hosts.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Do not allow drive redirection' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to prevent anonymous users from having the same permissions as the Everyone group.
metadata.description: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to prevent anonymous users from having the same permissions as the Everyone group.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Audit - System Integrity - Failure
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit System - System Integrity failures.

criterion.comment: Audit - System Integrity - Failure only
Audit - System Integrity - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Caching of logon credentials
metadata.description: Caching of logon credentials must be limited.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive Logon: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available)' is set to '4' logons or less

extend_definition.comment: System is a domain joined member server

metadata.title: WN16-UR-000100
metadata.description: The Create global objects user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.

criterion.comment: Create global objects - Administrators, Service, Local Service, Network Service

metadata.title: Hardened UNC Paths must be defined to require mutual authentication and integrity for at least the \\*\SYSVOL and \\*\NETLOGON shares.
metadata.description: Hardened UNC Paths must be defined to require mutual authentication and integrity for at least the \\*\SYSVOL and \\*\NETLOGON shares.

criteria.comment: non-domain system or has correct UNC path hardening

criterion.comment: Mutual Authentication and Integrity for \\*\SYSVOL
Mutual Authentication and Integrity for \\*\NETLOGON

metadata.title: Legal Notice Display
metadata.description: The required legal notice must be configured to display before console logon.

criterion.comment: Legal Notice is configured with the required text.
Legal Notice is configured with the shortened text version.

metadata.title: Restrict Anonymous Network Shares
metadata.description: Anonymous enumeration of shares must be restricted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000320
metadata.description: The System event log must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Specify the maximum log size (KB)' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Maximum Log Size (KB)' set to 32768 or higher

metadata.title: WN10-AU-000054
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout failures.

criterion.comment: Audit - Account Lockout - Failure only
Audit - Account Lockout - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - User Account Management - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - User Account Management - Success only
Audit - User Account Management - Success and Failure

metadata.title: WDigest Authentication must be disabled
metadata.description: WDigest Authentication must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies the WDigest Authentication is disabled.

metadata.title: User Account Control must run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode, enabling UAC.
metadata.description: User Account Control must run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode, enabling UAC.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Disable ICMP Redirect
metadata.description: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to prevent Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects from overriding Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) generated routes.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to force users to log off when their allowed logon hours expire.
metadata.description: The system must be configured to force users to log off when their allowed logon hours expire.

criterion.comment: Eventvwr.exe: Read and Execute rights for Administrators, System, Users, All Application Packages

metadata.title: WN16-CC-000410
metadata.description: Remote Desktop Services must be configured with the client connection encryption set to High Level.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Set client connection encryption level' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Encryption Level' set to 'High Level'

metadata.title: Kerberos - Computer Clock Sync
metadata.description: The computer clock synchronization tolerance must be limited to 5 minutes or less.

criterion.comment: Kerberos Policy - Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization - 5 minutes or less

metadata.title: WN16-PK-000030
metadata.description: The US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store on unclassified systems.

extend_definition.comment: Verifies the US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates are installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store.

metadata.title: Disable Guest Account
metadata.description: The built-in guest account must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Guest account status' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change successes.
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change successes.

extend_definition.comment: Windows2012 audit authentication policy change check.

metadata.title: Automatically signing in the last interactive user after a system-initiated restart must be disabled.
metadata.description: Automatically signing in the last interactive user after a system-initiated restart must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Sign-in last interactive user automatically after a system-initiated restart' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.

metadata.title: UR: Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services user right.

criteria.comment: IF system is a DC, THEN check Allow logon through RDS

criterion.comment: Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services - Administrators

metadata.title: Audit - Special Logon - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - Special Logon - Success only
Audit - Special Logon - Success and Failure

metadata.title: WN16-UR-000050
metadata.description: The Allow log on locally user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

criterion.comment: Allow log on locally - Administrators

Benchmark.title: Windows Server 2016 Security Technical Implementation Guide

html:div.html:p: This Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DoD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_sptmail.mil.
This content has been produced from an import of the
IASE Windows Server 2016 STIG V1R7
SCAP datastream into the Scapolite format.
Please refer to the slide set about Scapolite that has been presented at NISTs SCAP v2 workshop for more information about Scapolite.

The machine-readable information on how to implement the settings is not part of the original IASE DISA STIG; the information has been added using the mechanisms described in the slide set about automating implementation that has been presented at NISTs SCAP v2 workshop.

Copyright holder for the contents of the IASE Windows Server 2016 STIG V1R7, is IASE DISA, please refer to DoD CyberExchange Website for information about the STIGs and access to the authoritative versions of the STIGs. This project merely uses the STIG as an example of how SCAP content can be expressed and enriched in Scapolite.
For feedback/questions/discussion please use the mailing list
https://list.nist.gov/scap-dev-authoring
This profile disables rules known to have poor performance in some environments, such as systems with large numbers of user accounts.
This profile only includes rules that are Severity Category I.
The maximum number of failed attempts that can occur before the account is locked out

The time period in seconds to be used with the lockout threshold value. For example, if the threshold is set to 10 attempts and the duration is set to 15 minutes, then if more than 10 failed login attempts occur with a single user account within a 15-minute period, the account will be disabled. 15 minutes = 900 seconds
The number of passwords remembered
The maximum age in seconds before a password expires. (90 days = 7776000 seconds; 60 days = 5184000)
The minimum age in seconds before a password may be changed. 1 day = 86400 seconds
The minimum number of characters required for a password
This value determines whether Windows 7 implements a minimum level of strong password filtering. 1 = enabled

Value.title: Enforce Reversible Encryption When Storing Passwords

html:div.html:p: This value determines whether Windows Server 2016 is configured to prevent passwords from being stored using a two-way hash. 1 = enabled
Computer ConfigurationTemplatesComponentsUser Interface: Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation.

Value.title: MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)

html:div.html:p: Allowing source routed network traffic allows attackers to obscure their identity and location.

Value.title: MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)

html:div.html:p: IP source routing is a mechanism that allows the sender to determine the IP route that a datagram should take through the network. Microsoft recommends to configure this setting to Not Defined for enterprise environments and to Highest Protection for high security environments to completely disable source routing. HKLM

Value.title: MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes

html:div.html:p: Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects cause the stack to plumb host routes. These routes override the Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)generated routes, attackers can use source routed packets to conceal the address of their computer. HKLM

Value.title: MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers

html:div.html:p: MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers

Value.title: Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP

html:div.html:p: Computer ConfigurationTemplatesCommunication ManagementCommunication settings: Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP.
Computer ConfigurationTemplatesCommunication ManagementCommunication settings: Turn off printing over HTTP.

Value.title: Require a Password when a Computer Wakes (On Battery)

html:div.html:p: Computer ConfigurationTemplatesManagement: Sleep Settings - Require a Password when a Computer Wakes (On Battery).

Value.title: Require a Password when a Computer Wakes (Plugged)

html:div.html:p: Computer ConfigurationTemplatesManagement: Sleep Settings - Require a Password when a Computer Wakes (Plugged).
This policy controls the state of the Program Inventory collector in the system.
This policy setting determines whether autoplay is enabled for non volume devices.
default_behavior_for_autorun
The value defines the maximum size (in KB) of the application log.
The value defines the maximum size (in KB) of the security log.
The value defines the maximum size (in KB) of the system log.
turn_off_data_execution_prevention_for_explorer

Value.title: Turn off Heap termination on corruption

html:div.html:p: Turn off Heap termination on corruption

Value.title: Turn off shell protocol protected mode

html:div.html:p: Turn off shell protocol protected mode

Value.title: Do not allow passwords to be saved

html:div.html:p: Do not allow passwords to be saved
Do not allow drive redirection

Value.title: Always prompt for password upon connection

html:div.html:p: Always prompt for password upon connection
Require secure RPC communication
Set client connection encryption level
Prevent downloading of enclosures

Value.title: Turn on Basic feed authentication over HTTP

html:div.html:p: Turn on Basic feed authentication over HTTP
Allow user control over installs

Value.title: Prevent Internet Explorer security prompt for Windows Installer scriptsr

html:div.html:p: Prevent Internet Explorer security prompt for Windows Installer scripts
WinRM Client: Allow unencrypted traffic

Value.title: Accounts: Limit local account use to blank passwords to console logon only

html:div.html:p: This value defines the desired status of limiting the use of blank passwords. 1 = enabled; 0= disabled
This value defines the desired status of the built-in Guest account. 0 = disabled; 1 = enabled.

Rule.title: Systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level.

html:div.html:p: Systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level.

Systems at unsupported servicing levels will not receive security updates for new vulnerabilities, which leave them subject to exploitation. Systems must be maintained at a servicing level supported by the vendor with new security updates.
false
Update the system to a Version 1607 (Build 14393.xxx) or greater.

Rule.title: Local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes.

html:div.html:p: Local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes.

The ability to set access permissions and auditing is critical to maintaining the security and proper access controls of a system. To support this, volumes must be formatted using a file system that supports NTFS attributes.
false
Format volumes to use NTFS or ReFS.

Rule.title: Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows Server 2016.

html:div.html:p: Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows Server 2016.
Use of software certificates and their accompanying installation files for end users to access resources is less secure than the use of hardware-based certificates.
false
Remove any certificate installation files (.p12 and .pfx) found on a system.
This does not apply to server-based applications that have a requirement for certificate files.

Rule.title: The Fax Server role must not be installed.

html:div.html:p: The Fax Server role must not be installed.
Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption or may provide unauthorized access to the system.
false
Uninstall the Fax Server role.
Start Server Manager.
Select the server with the role.
Scroll down to ROLES AND FEATURES in the right pane.
Select Remove Roles and Features from the drop-down TASKS list.
Select the appropriate server on the Server Selection page and click Next.
Deselect Fax Server on the Roles page.
Click Next and Remove as prompted.

Rule.title: The Microsoft FTP service must not be installed unless required.

html:div.html:p: The Microsoft FTP service must not be installed unless required.
Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.
false
Uninstall the FTP Server role.
Start Server Manager.
Select the server with the role.
Scroll down to ROLES AND FEATURES in the right pane.
Select Remove Roles and Features from the drop-down TASKS list.
Select the appropriate server on the Server Selection page and click Next.
Deselect FTP Server under Web Server (IIS) on the Roles page.
Click Next and Remove as prompted.

Rule.title: The Peer Name Resolution Protocol must not be installed.

html:div.html:p: The Peer Name Resolution Protocol must not be installed.
Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption or may provide unauthorized access to the system.
false
Uninstall the Peer Name Resolution Protocol feature.
Start Server Manager.
Select the server with the feature.
Scroll down to ROLES AND FEATURES in the right pane.
Select Remove Roles and Features from the drop-down TASKS list.
Select the appropriate server on the Server Selection page and click Next.
Deselect Peer Name Resolution Protocol on the Features page.
Click Next and Remove as prompted.

Rule.title: Simple TCP/IP Services must not be installed.

html:div.html:p: Simple TCP/IP Services must not be installed.
Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption or may provide unauthorized access to the system.
false
Uninstall the Simple TCP/IP Services feature.
Start Server Manager.
Select the server with the feature.
Scroll down to ROLES AND FEATURES in the right pane.
Select Remove Roles and Features from the drop-down TASKS list.
Select the appropriate server on the Server Selection page and click Next.
Deselect Simple TCP/IP Services on the Features page.
Click Next and Remove as prompted.

Rule.title: The Telnet Client must not be installed.

html:div.html:p: The Telnet Client must not be installed.
Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption or may provide unauthorized access to the system.
false
Uninstall the Telnet Client feature.
Start Server Manager.
Select the server with the feature.
Scroll down to ROLES AND FEATURES in the right pane.
Select Remove Roles and Features from the drop-down TASKS list.
Select the appropriate server on the Server Selection page and click Next.
Deselect Telnet Client on the Features page.
Click Next and Remove as prompted.

Rule.title: The TFTP Client must not be installed.

html:div.html:p: The TFTP Client must not be installed.
Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption or may provide unauthorized access to the system.
false
Uninstall the TFTP Client feature.
Start Server Manager.
Select the server with the feature.
Scroll down to ROLES AND FEATURES in the right pane.
Select Remove Roles and Features from the drop-down TASKS list.
Select the appropriate server on the Server Selection page and click Next.
Deselect TFTP Client on the Features page.
Click Next and Remove as prompted.

Rule.title: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be uninstalled.

html:div.html:p: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be uninstalled.
SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks and is not FIPS compliant.
false
Uninstall the SMBv1 protocol.
Open Windows PowerShell with elevated privileges (run as administrator).
Enter Uninstall-WindowsFeature -Name FS-SMB1 -Restart. (Omit the Restart parameter if an immediate restart of the system cannot be done.)
Alternately:
Start Server Manager.
Select the server with the feature.
Scroll down to ROLES AND FEATURES in the right pane.
Select Remove Roles and Features from the drop-down TASKS list.
Select the appropriate server on the Server Selection page and click Next.
Deselect SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support on the Features page.
Click Next and Remove as prompted.

Rule.title: Windows PowerShell 2.0 must not be installed.

html:div.html:p: Windows PowerShell 2.0 must not be installed.

Windows PowerShell 5.0 added advanced logging features that can provide additional detail when malware has been run on a system. Disabling the Windows PowerShell 2.0 mitigates against a downgrade attack that evades the Windows PowerShell 5.0 script block logging feature.
false
Uninstall the Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine.
Start Server Manager.
Select the server with the feature.
Scroll down to ROLES AND FEATURES in the right pane.
Select Remove Roles and Features from the drop-down TASKS list.
Select the appropriate server on the Server Selection page and click Next.
Deselect Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine under Windows PowerShell on the Features page.
Click Next and Remove as prompted.

Rule.title: Windows 2016 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

html:div.html:p: Windows 2016 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that an account will remain locked after the specified number of failed logon attempts.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> Account lockout duration to 15 minutes or greater.
A value of 0 is also acceptable, requiring an administrator to unlock the account.

Rule.title: The number of allowed bad logon attempts must be configured to three or less.

html:div.html:p: The number of allowed bad logon attempts must be configured to three or less.

The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. The higher this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system. The number of bad logon attempts must be reasonably small to minimize the possibility of a successful password attack while allowing for honest errors made during normal user logon.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> Account lockout threshold to 3 or fewer invalid logon attempts (excluding 0, which is unacceptable).

Rule.title: The period of time before the bad logon counter is reset must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

html:div.html:p: The period of time before the bad logon counter is reset must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that must pass after failed logon attempts before the counter is reset to 0. The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000021-GPOS-00005, SRG-OS-000329-GPOS-00128
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> Reset account lockout counter after to at least 15 minutes.

Rule.title: The password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.

html:div.html:p: The password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.

A system is more vulnerable to unauthorized access when system users recycle the same password several times without being required to change to a unique password on a regularly scheduled basis. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. The default value is 24 for Windows domain systems. DoD has decided this is the appropriate value for all Windows systems.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Enforce password history to 24 passwords remembered.

Rule.title: The maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less.

html:div.html:p: The maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less.

The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the passwords. Scheduled changing of passwords hinders the ability of unauthorized system users to crack passwords and gain access to a system.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Maximum password age to 60 days or less (excluding 0, which is unacceptable).

Rule.title: The minimum password age must be configured to at least one day.

html:div.html:p: The minimum password age must be configured to at least one day.

Permitting passwords to be changed in immediate succession within the same day allows users to cycle passwords through their history database. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Minimum password age to at least 1 day.

Rule.title: The minimum password length must be configured to 14 characters.

html:div.html:p: The minimum password length must be configured to 14 characters.

Information systems not protected with strong password schemes (including passwords of minimum length) provide the opportunity for anyone to crack the password, thus gaining access to the system and compromising the device, information, or the local network.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Minimum password length to 14 characters.

Rule.title: The built-in Windows password complexity policy must be enabled.

html:div.html:p: The built-in Windows password complexity policy must be enabled.

The use of complex passwords increases their strength against attack. The built-in Windows password complexity policy requires passwords to contain at least three of the four types of characters (numbers, upper- and lower-case letters, and special characters) and prevents the inclusion of user names or parts of user names.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000069-GPOS-00037, SRG-OS-000070-GPOS-00038, SRG-OS-000071-GPOS-00039, SRG-OS-000266-GPOS-00101
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Password must meet complexity requirements to Enabled.

Rule.title: Reversible password encryption must be disabled.

html:div.html:p: Reversible password encryption must be disabled.

Storing passwords using reversible encryption is essentially the same as storing clear-text versions of the passwords, which are easily compromised. For this reason, this policy must never be enabled.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Store passwords using reversible encryption to Disabled.

Rule.title: Kerberos user logon restrictions must be enforced.

html:div.html:p: Kerberos user logon restrictions must be enforced.

This policy setting determines whether the Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC) validates every request for a session ticket against the user rights policy of the target computer. The policy is enabled by default, which is the most secure setting for validating that access to target resources is not circumvented.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000112-GPOS-00057, SRG-OS-000113-GPOS-00058
false

Configure the policy value in the Default Domain Policy for Computer Configuration >> Policies >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Kerberos Policy >> Enforce user logon restrictions to Enabled.

Rule.title: The Kerberos service ticket maximum lifetime must be limited to 600 minutes or less.

html:div.html:p: The Kerberos service ticket maximum lifetime must be limited to 600 minutes or less.

This setting determines the maximum amount of time (in minutes) that a granted session ticket can be used to access a particular service. Session tickets are used only to authenticate new connections with servers. Ongoing operations are not interrupted if the session ticket used to authenticate the connection expires during the connection.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000112-GPOS-00057, SRG-OS-000113-GPOS-00058
false

Configure the policy value in the Default Domain Policy for Computer Configuration >> Policies >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Kerberos Policy >> Maximum lifetime for service ticket to a maximum of 600 minutes, but not 0, which equates to Ticket doesnt expire.

Rule.title: The Kerberos user ticket lifetime must be limited to 10 hours or less.

html:div.html:p: The Kerberos user ticket lifetime must be limited to 10 hours or less.

In Kerberos, there are two types of tickets: Ticket Granting Tickets (TGTs) and Service Tickets. Kerberos tickets have a limited lifetime so the time an attacker has to implement an attack is limited. This policy controls how long TGTs can be renewed. With Kerberos, the users initial authentication to the domain controller results in a TGT, which is then used to request Service Tickets to resources. Upon startup, each computer gets a TGT before requesting a service ticket to the domain controller and any other computers it needs to access. For services that start up under a specified user account, users must always get a TGT first and then get Service Tickets to all computers and services accessed.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000112-GPOS-00057, SRG-OS-000113-GPOS-00058
false

Configure the policy value in the Default Domain Policy for Computer Configuration >> Policies >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Kerberos Policy >> Maximum lifetime for user ticket to a maximum of 10 hours but not 0, which equates to Ticket doesnt expire.

Rule.title: The Kerberos policy user ticket renewal maximum lifetime must be limited to seven days or less.

html:div.html:p: The Kerberos policy user ticket renewal maximum lifetime must be limited to seven days or less.

This setting determines the period of time (in days) during which a users Ticket Granting Ticket (TGT) may be renewed. This security configuration limits the amount of time an attacker has to crack the TGT and gain access.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000112-GPOS-00057, SRG-OS-000113-GPOS-00058
false

Configure the policy value in the Default Domain Policy for Computer Configuration >> Policies >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Kerberos Policy >> Maximum lifetime for user ticket renewal to a maximum of 7 days or less.

Rule.title: The computer clock synchronization tolerance must be limited to 5 minutes or less.

html:div.html:p: The computer clock synchronization tolerance must be limited to 5 minutes or less.

This setting determines the maximum time difference (in minutes) that Kerberos will tolerate between the time on a clients clock and the time on a servers clock while still considering the two clocks synchronous. In order to prevent replay attacks, Kerberos uses timestamps as part of its protocol definition. For timestamps to work properly, the clocks of the client and the server need to be in sync as much as possible.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000112-GPOS-00057, SRG-OS-000113-GPOS-00058
false

Configure the policy value in the Default Domain Policy for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Kerberos Policy >> Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization to a maximum of 5 minutes or less.

Rule.title: Permissions on the Active Directory data files must only allow System and Administrators access.

html:div.html:p: Permissions on the Active Directory data files must only allow System and Administrators access.
Improper access permissions for directory data-related files could allow unauthorized users to read, modify, or delete directory data or audit trails.
false
Maintain the permissions on NTDS database and log files as follows:
NT AUTHORITY:(I)(F) BUILTIN:(I)(F)

Rule.title: Permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

html:div.html:p: Permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
false
Configure the permissions on the Application event log file (Application.evtx) to prevent access by non-privileged accounts. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:
Eventlog - Full Control SYSTEM - Full Control Administrators - Full Control
The default location is the %SystemRoot%System32 folder.
If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as NT Service.

Rule.title: Permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

html:div.html:p: Permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
false
Configure the permissions on the Security event log file (Security.evtx) to prevent access by non-privileged accounts. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:
Eventlog - Full Control SYSTEM - Full Control Administrators - Full Control
The default location is the %SystemRoot%System32 folder.
If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as NT Service.

Rule.title: Permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

html:div.html:p: Permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
false
Configure the permissions on the System event log file (System.evtx) to prevent access by non-privileged accounts. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:
Eventlog - Full Control SYSTEM - Full Control Administrators - Full Control
The default location is the %SystemRoot%System32 folder.
If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as NT Service.

Rule.title: Event Viewer must be protected from unauthorized modification and deletion.

html:div.html:p: Event Viewer must be protected from unauthorized modification and deletion.

Protecting audit information also includes identifying and protecting the tools used to view and manipulate log data. Therefore, protecting audit tools is necessary to prevent unauthorized operation on audit information.

Operating systems providing tools to interface with audit information will leverage user permissions and roles identifying the user accessing the tools and the corresponding rights the user enjoys in order to make access decisions regarding the modification or deletion of audit tools.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098, SRG-OS-000258-GPOS-00099
false
Configure the permissions on the Eventvwr.exe file to prevent modification by any groups or accounts other than TrustedInstaller. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:
TrustedInstaller - Full Control Administrators, SYSTEM, Users, ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES, ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES - Read & Execute
The default location is the %SystemRoot%System32 folder.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Credential Validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Logon >> Audit Credential Validation with Success selected.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Credential Validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Logon >> Audit Credential Validation with Failure selected.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Other Account Management Events successes.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Other Account Management Events successes.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Other Account Management Events records events such as the access of a password hash or the Password Policy Checking API being called.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> Audit Other Account Management Events with Success selected.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Security Group Management records events such as creating, deleting, or changing security groups, including changes in group members.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> Audit Security Group Management with Success selected.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> Audit User Account Management with Success selected.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management failures.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management failures.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> Audit User Account Management with Failure selected.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Process Creation records events related to the creation of a process and the source.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> Audit Process Creation with Success selected.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit DS Access - Directory Service Access successes.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit DS Access - Directory Service Access successes.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Rule.title: Administrator accounts must not be enumerated during elevation.

html:div.html:p: Administrator accounts must not be enumerated during elevation.

Enumeration of administrator accounts when elevating can provide part of the logon information to an unauthorized user. This setting configures the system to always require users to type in a username and password to elevate a running application.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Credential User Interface >> Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation to Disabled.

Rule.title: The display of slide shows on the lock screen must be disabled.

html:div.html:p: The display of slide shows on the lock screen must be disabled.
Slide shows that are displayed on the lock screen could display sensitive information to unauthorized personnel. Turning off this feature will limit access to the information to a logged-on user.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Control Panel >> Personalization >> Prevent enabling lock screen slide show to Enabled.

Rule.title: Local administrator accounts must have their privileged token filtered to prevent elevated privileges from being used over the network on domain systems.

html:div.html:p: Local administrator accounts must have their privileged token filtered to prevent elevated privileges from being used over the network on domain systems.
A compromised local administrator account can provide means for an attacker to move laterally between domain systems.
With User Account Control enabled, filtering the privileged token for local administrator accounts will prevent the elevated privileges of these accounts from being used over the network.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> Apply UAC restrictions to local accounts on network logons to Enabled.

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. SecGuide.admx and " SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the and -US directories respectively.

Rule.title: WDigest Authentication must be disabled.

html:div.html:p: WDigest Authentication must be disabled.

When the WDigest Authentication protocol is enabled, plain-text passwords are stored in the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS), exposing them to theft. WDigest is disabled by default in Windows 10. This setting ensures this is enforced.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> WDigest Authentication (disabling may require KB2871997) to Disabled.

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. SecGuide.admx and " SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the and -US directories respectively.

Rule.title: Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent IP source routing.

html:div.html:p: Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent IP source routing.
Configuring the system to disable IPv6 source routing protects against spoofing.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MSS (Legacy) >> MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing) to Enabled with Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled selected.

This policy setting requires the installation of the MSS-Legacy custom templates included with the STIG package. MSS-Legacy.admx and MSS-Legacy.adml must be copied to the and -US directories respectively.

Rule.title: Source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent Internet Protocol (IP) source routing.

html:div.html:p: Source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent Internet Protocol (IP) source routing.
Configuring the system to disable IP source routing protects against spoofing.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MSS (Legacy) >> MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing) to Enabled with Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled selected.

This policy setting requires the installation of the MSS-Legacy custom templates included with the STIG package. MSS-Legacy.admx and MSS-Legacy.adml must be copied to the and -US directories respectively.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to prevent Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects from overriding Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)-generated routes.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to prevent Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects from overriding Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)-generated routes.
Allowing ICMP redirect of routes can lead to traffic not being routed properly. When disabled, this forces ICMP to be routed via the shortest path first.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MSS (Legacy) >> MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes to Disabled.

This policy setting requires the installation of the MSS-Legacy custom templates included with the STIG package. MSS-Legacy.admx and MSS-Legacy.adml must be copied to the and -US directories respectively.

Rule.title: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers.

html:div.html:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers.

Configuring the system to ignore name release requests, except from WINS servers, prevents a denial of service (DoS) attack. The DoS consists of sending a NetBIOS name release request to the server for each entry in the servers cache, causing a response delay in the normal operation of the servers WINS resolution capability.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MSS (Legacy) >> MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow the computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers to Enabled.

This policy setting requires the installation of the MSS-Legacy custom templates included with the STIG package. MSS-Legacy.admx and MSS-Legacy.adml must be copied to the and -US directories respectively.

Rule.title: Insecure logons to an SMB server must be disabled.

html:div.html:p: Insecure logons to an SMB server must be disabled.
Insecure guest logons allow unauthenticated access to shared folders. Shared resources on a system must require authentication to establish proper access.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Lanman Workstation >> Enable insecure guest logons to Disabled.

Rule.title: Hardened UNC paths must be defined to require mutual authentication and integrity for at least the \\*\SYSVOL and \\*\NETLOGON shares.

html:div.html:p: Hardened UNC paths must be defined to require mutual authentication and integrity for at least the \and \shares.

Additional security requirements are applied to Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths specified in hardened UNC paths before allowing access to them. This aids in preventing tampering with or spoofing of connections to these paths.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Network Provider >> Hardened UNC Paths to Enabled with at least the following configured in Hardened UNC Paths: (click the Show button to display)
Value Name: \* Value: RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1
Value Name: \* Value: RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1

Rule.title: Command line data must be included in process creation events.

html:div.html:p: Command line data must be included in process creation events.

Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Enabling Include command line data for process creation events will record the command line information with the process creation events in the log. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Audit Process Creation >> Include command line in process creation events to Enabled.

Rule.title: Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers identified as bad.

html:div.html:p: Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers identified as bad.

Compromised boot drivers can introduce malware prior to protection mechanisms that load after initialization. The Early Launch Antimalware driver can limit allowed drivers based on classifications determined by the malware protection application. At a minimum, drivers determined to be bad must not be allowed.
false
The default behavior is for Early Launch Antimalware - Boot-Start Driver Initialization policy to enforce Good, unknown and bad but critical (preventing bad).

If this needs to be corrected or a more secure setting is desired, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Early Launch Antimalware >> Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy to Not Configured or Enabled with any option other than All selected.

Rule.title: Group Policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed.

html:div.html:p: Group Policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed.

Registry entries for group policy settings can potentially be changed from the required configuration. This could occur as part of troubleshooting or by a malicious process on a compromised system. Enabling this setting and then selecting the Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed option ensures the policies will be reprocessed even if none have been changed. This way, any unauthorized changes are forced to match the domain-based group policy settings again.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Group Policy >> Configure registry policy processing to Enabled with the option Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed selected.

Rule.title: Downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be prevented.

html:div.html:p: Downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be prevented.

Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and will prevent uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents the computer from downloading print driver packages over HTTP.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Internet Communication Management >> Internet Communication settings >> Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP to Enabled.

Rule.title: Printing over HTTP must be prevented.

html:div.html:p: Printing over HTTP must be prevented.

Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and will prevent uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents the client computer from printing over HTTP, which allows the computer to print to printers on the intranet as well as the Internet.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Internet Communication Management >> Internet Communication settings >> Turn off printing over HTTP to Enabled.

Rule.title: The network selection user interface (UI) must not be displayed on the logon screen.

html:div.html:p: The network selection user interface (UI) must not be displayed on the logon screen.
Enabling interaction with the network selection UI allows users to change connections to available networks without signing in to Windows.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Logon >> Do not display network selection UI to Enabled.

Rule.title: Local users on domain-joined computers must not be enumerated.

html:div.html:p: Local users on domain-joined computers must not be enumerated.
The username is one part of logon credentials that could be used to gain access to a system. Preventing the enumeration of users limits this information to authorized personnel.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Logon >> Enumerate local users on domain-joined computers to Disabled.

Rule.title: Users must be prompted to authenticate when the system wakes from sleep (on battery).

html:div.html:p: Users must be prompted to authenticate when the system wakes from sleep (on battery).

A system that does not require authentication when resuming from sleep may provide access to unauthorized users. Authentication must always be required when accessing a system. This setting ensures users are prompted for a password when the system wakes from sleep (on battery).
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Power Management >> Sleep Settings >> Require a password when a computer wakes (on battery) to Enabled.

Rule.title: Users must be prompted to authenticate when the system wakes from sleep (plugged in).

html:div.html:p: Users must be prompted to authenticate when the system wakes from sleep (plugged in).

A system that does not require authentication when resuming from sleep may provide access to unauthorized users. Authentication must always be required when accessing a system. This setting ensures users are prompted for a password when the system wakes from sleep (plugged in).
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Power Management >> Sleep Settings >> Require a password when a computer wakes (plugged in) to Enabled.

Rule.title: Unauthenticated Remote Procedure Call (RPC) clients must be restricted from connecting to the RPC server.

html:div.html:p: Unauthenticated Remote Procedure Call (RPC) clients must be restricted from connecting to the RPC server.

Unauthenticated RPC clients may allow anonymous access to sensitive information. Configuring RPC to restrict unauthenticated RPC clients from connecting to the RPC server will prevent anonymous connections.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Remote Procedure Call >> Restrict Unauthenticated RPC clients to Enabled with Authenticated selected.

Rule.title: The Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft.

html:div.html:p: The Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft.

Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and will prevent uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting will prevent the Program Inventory from collecting data about a system and sending the information to Microsoft.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Application Compatibility >> Turn off Inventory Collector to Enabled.

Rule.title: AutoPlay must be turned off for non-volume devices.

html:div.html:p: AutoPlay must be turned off for non-volume devices.

Allowing AutoPlay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. AutoPlay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted into the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. This setting will disable AutoPlay for non-volume devices, such as Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) devices.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices to Enabled.

Rule.title: The default AutoRun behavior must be configured to prevent AutoRun commands.

html:div.html:p: The default AutoRun behavior must be configured to prevent AutoRun commands.
Allowing AutoRun commands to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Configuring this setting prevents AutoRun commands from executing.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> Set the default behavior for AutoRun to Enabled with Do not execute any autorun commands selected.

Rule.title: AutoPlay must be disabled for all drives.

html:div.html:p: AutoPlay must be disabled for all drives.

Allowing AutoPlay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. AutoPlay begins reading from a drive as soon media is inserted into the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. By default, AutoPlay is disabled on removable drives, such as the floppy disk drive (but not the CD-ROM drive) and on network drives. Enabling this policy disables AutoPlay on all drives.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> Turn off AutoPlay to Enabled with All Drives selected.

Rule.title: Windows Telemetry must be configured to Security or Basic.

html:div.html:p: Windows Telemetry must be configured to Security or Basic.

Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Limiting this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise. The Security option for Telemetry configures the lowest amount of data, effectively none outside of the Malicious Software Removal Tool (MSRT), Defender, and telemetry client settings. Basic sends basic diagnostic and usage data and may be required to support some Microsoft services.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Data Collection and Preview Builds>> Allow Telemetry to Enabled with 0 - Security [Enterprise Only] or 1 - Basic selected in Options.

Rule.title: The Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.

html:div.html:p: The Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.
Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Application >> Specify the maximum log file size (KB) to Enabled with a Maximum Log Size (KB) of 32768 or greater.

Rule.title: The Security event log size must be configured to 196608 KB or greater.

html:div.html:p: The Security event log size must be configured to 196608 KB or greater.
Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Security >> Specify the maximum log file size (KB) to Enabled with a Maximum Log Size (KB) of 196608 or greater.

Rule.title: The System event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.

html:div.html:p: The System event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.
Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> System >> Specify the maximum log file size (KB) to Enabled with a Maximum Log Size (KB) of 32768 or greater.

Rule.title: Windows SmartScreen must be enabled.

html:div.html:p: Windows SmartScreen must be enabled.
Windows SmartScreen helps protect systems from programs downloaded from the internet that may be malicious. Enabling SmartScreen will warn users of potentially malicious programs.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> Configure Windows SmartScreen to Enabled.

Rule.title: Explorer Data Execution Prevention must be enabled.

html:div.html:p: Explorer Data Execution Prevention must be enabled.

Data Execution Prevention provides additional protection by performing checks on memory to help prevent malicious code from running. This setting will prevent Data Execution Prevention from being turned off for File Explorer.
false
The default behavior is for data execution prevention to be turned on for File Explorer.

If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer to Not Configured or Disabled.

Rule.title: Turning off File Explorer heap termination on corruption must be disabled.

html:div.html:p: Turning off File Explorer heap termination on corruption must be disabled.
Legacy plug-in applications may continue to function when a File Explorer session has become corrupt. Disabling this feature will prevent this.
false
The default behavior is for File Explorer heap termination on corruption to be disabled.

If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> Turn off heap termination on corruption to Not Configured or Disabled.

Rule.title: File Explorer shell protocol must run in protected mode.

html:div.html:p: File Explorer shell protocol must run in protected mode.

The shell protocol will limit the set of folders that applications can open when run in protected mode. Restricting files an application can open to a limited set of folders increases the security of Windows.
false
The default behavior is for shell protected mode to be turned on for File Explorer.

If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> Turn off shell protocol protected mode to Not Configured or Disabled.

Rule.title: Passwords must not be saved in the Remote Desktop Client.

html:div.html:p: Passwords must not be saved in the Remote Desktop Client.

Saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client could allow an unauthorized user to establish a remote desktop session to another system. The system must be configured to prevent users from saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Connection Client >> Do not allow passwords to be saved to Enabled.

Rule.title: Local drives must be prevented from sharing with Remote Desktop Session Hosts.

html:div.html:p: Local drives must be prevented from sharing with Remote Desktop Session Hosts.
Preventing users from sharing the local drives on their client computers with Remote Session Hosts that they access helps reduce possible exposure of sensitive data.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Session Host >> Device and Resource Redirection >> Do not allow drive redirection to Enabled.

Rule.title: Remote Desktop Services must always prompt a client for passwords upon connection.

html:div.html:p: Remote Desktop Services must always prompt a client for passwords upon connection.

This setting controls the ability of users to supply passwords automatically as part of their remote desktop connection. Disabling this setting would allow anyone to use the stored credentials in a connection item to connect to the terminal server.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Session Host >> Security >> Always prompt for password upon connection to Enabled.

Rule.title: The Remote Desktop Session Host must require secure Remote Procedure Call (RPC) communications.

html:div.html:p: The Remote Desktop Session Host must require secure Remote Procedure Call (RPC) communications.

Allowing unsecure RPC communication exposes the system to man-in-the-middle attacks and data disclosure attacks. A man-in-the-middle attack occurs when an intruder captures packets between a client and server and modifies them before allowing the packets to be exchanged. Usually the attacker will modify the information in the packets in an attempt to cause either the client or server to reveal sensitive information.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Session Host >> Security >> Require secure RPC communication to Enabled.

Rule.title: Remote Desktop Services must be configured with the client connection encryption set to High Level.

html:div.html:p: Remote Desktop Services must be configured with the client connection encryption set to High Level.
Remote connections must be encrypted to prevent interception of data or sensitive information. Selecting High Level will ensure encryption of Remote Desktop Services sessions in both directions.
false

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Session Host >> Security >> Set client connection encryption level to Enabled with High Level selected.

Rule.title: Attachments must be prevented from being downloaded from RSS feeds.

html:div.html:p: Attachments must be prevented from being downloaded from RSS feeds.
Attachments from RSS feeds may not be secure. This setting will prevent attachments from being downloaded from RSS feeds.
false
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> RSS Feeds >> Prevent downloading of enclosures to Enabled.

Rule.title: Basic authentication for RSS feeds over HTTP must not be used.
